title: Authors and Citation
text: Kotov E (2024). rJavaEnv: Java Environments R Projects. R package version 0.0.0.9000, http://www.ekotov.pro/rJavaEnv/, https://github.com/e-kotov/rJavaEnv.
code: @Manual{,   title = {rJavaEnv: Java Environments for R Projects},   author = {Egor Kotov},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000, http://www.ekotov.pro/rJavaEnv/},   url = {https://github.com/e-kotov/rJavaEnv}, }

title: Java Environments for R Projects
text: goal rJavaEnv manage multiple Java JDK R projects automating process downloading, installing configuring Java environments per-project basis. package inspired renv package managing R environments R projects. idea can request specific Java Development Kit (JDK) project, rJavaEnv download install requested Java environment project-specific directory set PATH variable using project. Therefore, can Amazon Corretto Java 21 project uses r5r package, Adoptium Eclipse Temurin Java 8 project uses opentripplanner package. Actually, Java installed machine . Java JDK ‘flavour’ quietly live executables respective project directory without contaminating system. WARNING package early stages development yet ready production use. Function names, arguments, behaviour may change future versions.

title: Java Environments for R Projects
text: can install development version rJavaEnv like :

what: 1. Simple - install Java in current directory/project and set environment
title: Java Environments for R Projects
text: download Java 21 distribution, install current project directory, set Java environment Java 8, one command, hassle. Afer , can use Java-based R packages project without worrying Java versions.
code: library(rJavaEnv) java_quick_install(version = 21) #> Detected platform: macos #> Detected architecture: arm64 #> You can change the platform and architecture by specifying the 'platform' and 'arch' arguments. #> Downloading Java 21 (Corretto) for macos arm64 to /Users/ek/Library/Caches/org.R-project.R/R/rJavaEnv/amazon-corretto-21-aarch64-macos-jdk.tar.gz #> File already exists. Skipping download. #> JAVA_HOME set to /Users/ek/home/sync/personal/code_repository/pet_projects/rJavaEnv/rjavaenv/macos/aarch64/21 from config #> Java 21 (amazon-corretto-21-aarch64-macos-jdk.tar.gz) for macos installed at /Users/ek/home/sync/personal/code_repository/pet_projects/rJavaEnv/rjavaenv/macos/aarch64/21

title: Java Environments for R Projects
text: distribution cached user-specific data directory. Let us download Java 8 22 default flavour (currently, Amazon Corretto). function’s output path downloaded Java distribution file.
code: java_8_distrib_path <- rJavaEnv::download_java(version = 8) #> Detected platform: macos #> Detected architecture: arm64 #> You can change the platform and architecture by specifying the 'platform' and 'arch' arguments. #> Downloading Java 8 (Corretto) for macos arm64 to /Users/ek/Library/Caches/org.R-project.R/R/rJavaEnv/amazon-corretto-8-aarch64-macos-jdk.tar.gz #> File already exists. Skipping download. java_22_distrib_path <- rJavaEnv::download_java(version = 22) #> Detected platform: macos #> Detected architecture: arm64 #> You can change the platform and architecture by specifying the 'platform' and 'arch' arguments. #> Downloading Java 22 (Corretto) for macos arm64 to /Users/ek/Library/Caches/org.R-project.R/R/rJavaEnv/amazon-corretto-22-aarch64-macos-jdk.tar.gz #> File already exists. Skipping download.

previous_headings: 2. Extended example - do things step by step
title: Java Environments for R Projects
text: Install Java 8 22 downloaded file current project/working directory. default install path ./rjavaenv/platform/processor_architecture/ folder current working/project directory, can customised, see docs rJavaEnv::install_java(). output function path installed Java directory. Note default rJavaEnv::install_java() sets JAVA_HOME PATH environment variables installed Java directory, can turn autoset_java_path argument.
code: java_8_install_path <- rJavaEnv::install_java(java_8_distrib_path) #> JAVA_HOME set to /Users/ek/home/sync/personal/code_repository/pet_projects/rJavaEnv/rjavaenv/macos/aarch64/8 from config #> Java 8 (amazon-corretto-8-aarch64-macos-jdk.tar.gz) for macos installed at /Users/ek/home/sync/personal/code_repository/pet_projects/rJavaEnv/rjavaenv/macos/aarch64/8 java_22_install_path <- rJavaEnv::install_java(java_22_distrib_path) #> JAVA_HOME set to /Users/ek/home/sync/personal/code_repository/pet_projects/rJavaEnv/rjavaenv/macos/aarch64/22 from config #> Java 22 (amazon-corretto-22-aarch64-macos-jdk.tar.gz) for macos installed at /Users/ek/home/sync/personal/code_repository/pet_projects/rJavaEnv/rjavaenv/macos/aarch64/22

title: Java Environments for R Projects
text: installed two Java environments project directory. installed version 22 last, default Java environment, rJavaEnv::install_java() sets JAVA_HOME PATH environment variables installed Java directory default. However, since yet initialised Java using rJava::.jinit() using rJava-dependent package, Java environment yet set current R session irreversibly. can set desired Java environment manually. function sets JAVA_HOME PATH environment variables desired Java environment.
code: rJavaEnv::set_java_env(java_8_install_path) #> JAVA_HOME set to /Users/ek/home/sync/personal/code_repository/pet_projects/rJavaEnv/rjavaenv/macos/aarch64/8 #> Appended JAVA_HOME settings to .Rprofile in '/Users/ek/home/sync/personal/code_repository/pet_projects/rJavaEnv/.Rprofile'

previous_headings: 2. Extended example - do things step by step
title: Java Environments for R Projects
text: Check using system commands. relevant packages like opentripplanner don’t actually use rJava, manage Java process using system commands. Finally, check Java version using rJava. relevant packages like r5r depend rJava. ’s ! successfully installed set Java environments project directory. can now use Java-based R packages project without worrying Java versions.
code: check_java_version_cmd() #> JAVA_HOME: /Users/ek/home/sync/personal/code_repository/pet_projects/rJavaEnv/rjavaenv/macos/aarch64/8 #> Java path: /Users/ek/home/sync/personal/code_repository/pet_projects/rJavaEnv/rjavaenv/macos/aarch64/8/bin/java #> Java version: #> openjdk version "1.8.0_412" #> OpenJDK Runtime Environment Corretto-8.412.08.1 (build 1.8.0_412-b08) #> OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM Corretto-8.412.08.1 (build 25.412-b08, mixed mode) rJava::.jinit(force.init = TRUE) rJava::.jcall("java.lang.System", "S", "getProperty", "java.version") #> [1] "1.8.0_412"

title: Java Environments for R Projects
text: limitation want switch another Java environment, restart current R session set JAVA_HOME PATH environment variables desired Java environment scratch using rJavaEnv::set_java_env(). done dynamically within R session due way Java initialized R. Therefore, need use R packages depend different Java versions within project, create separate R scripts Java environment run separate R sessions. One effective way use callr package run R scripts separate R sessions. Another option use targets package manage whole project workflow, , side effect, lead R scripts run separate R sessions.

title: Java Environments for R Projects
text: Check cache created package store downloaded Java distributions. Remove cache created package store downloaded Java distributions. remove Java distributions already unpacked current working/project folder, just delete default user defined folder:
code: rJavaEnv::list_java_distributions_cache() #> Contents of the Java distributions cache folder: #> [1] "amazon-corretto-21-aarch64-macos-jdk.tar.gz" #> [2] "amazon-corretto-22-aarch64-macos-jdk.tar.gz" #> [3] "amazon-corretto-8-aarch64-macos-jdk.tar.gz" rJavaEnv::clear_java_distributions_cache(confirm = FALSE) unlink("./rjavaenv", recursive = TRUE)

title: Download a Java distribution — download_java
code: download_java(   version = 21,   distribution = "Corretto",   dest_dir = tools::R_user_dir("rJavaEnv", which = "cache"),   platform = .detect_platform()$os,   arch = .detect_platform()$arch,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Download a Java distribution — download_java
text: version Java version download. specified, defaults latest LTS version. distribution Java distribution download. specified, defaults "Corretto". dest_dir destination directory download Java distribution . Defaults user-specific data directory. platform platform download Java distribution. Defaults current platform. arch architecture download Java distribution. Defaults current architecture.

title: Activate a project-specific Java environment — rje_activate

title: Deactivate a project-specific Java environment — rje_deactivate
